summary: This is the last will and testament of Jeffrey E. Epstein, in which he designates executors for his estate and directs that all his property be transferred to The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2013 Trust upon his death. The document outlines payment instructions for expenses, taxes, and executor compensation.

events.title: Creation of The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2013 Trust
events.description: The trust agreement establishing The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2013 Trust was dated.

locations: Little St. James Island, St. Thomas, United States Virgin Islands
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's will directs that all his property be transferred to The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2013 Trust upon his death.
Epstein appointed Darren K. Indyke, Joseph Pagano, and James E. Staley as executors of his will, with David Mitchell named as successor executor.
Each executor is to receive $250,000 compensation upon completion of probate, with no other compensation for serving.
The will revokes all prior wills and codicils made by Epstein.
The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2013 Trust was created under a trust agreement dated September 16, 2013.
